column4: Hi, I downloaded ubuntu 64 bit version, and it says ubuntu AMD_64, is there not an IA_64 version as well?
AMD is for x86 processors... I'm not really sure what your asking
IA_64 is intels competing 64 bit archetecture I thought
oh.. ok, they arcitector types used for the linux kernel isn't exact to the brand, just the type.. AMD and Intel make x86... short answer.. you have the right one.
apt-get install linux-source linux-headers  ...second time I said it.
couldn't find package linux-source ...second time I said it.

lol Did you do this command? "sudo apt-get install linux-source ...second time I said it."   cause that's funny... Don't execute every command you see... there's a popular one that will render your systen unusable... goes something like this rm -rf /bla
no, I was making a wise crack
yes. lol and I'm all about the wise cracks... It's kinda nice to be here again. I've been gone a few years now.
honestly... sudo apt-get install linux-source linux-headers
I don't understand whats complicated about what I said
me either.. so direct and precisely about one thing too.
Do you think I'm just making it up that that apt-get is not finding linux-sources?
A seemingly stupid question but are you pasting that command into a terminal?
I'm not thinking anything about it. I just answered a question.
